metadata.title: Tutorials
metadata.description: Start learning with step-by-step, hands-on, command-line tutorials, videos, and hosted terminal sessions. Actionable examples help you learn to provision, secure, connect, or run any application on any infrastructure.

certification.title: Get certified: Infrastructure automation
certification.description: Validate your infrastructure automation skills by studying for and passing the Terraform Associate certification exam.

featuredCollections.name: Get Started - AWS
featuredCollections.description: Build, change, and destroy AWS infrastructure using Terraform. Step-by-step, command-line tutorials will walk you through the Terraform basics for the first time.

tutorials.name: What is Infrastructure as Code with Terraform?
tutorials.description: Learn how infrastructure as code lets you safely build, change, and manage infrastructure. Try Terraform.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Install Terraform
tutorials.description: Install Terraform on Mac, Linux, or Windows by downloading the binary or using a package manager (Homebrew or Chocolatey). Then create a Docker container locally by following a quick-start tutorial to check that Terraform installed correctly.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Build infrastructure
tutorials.description: Authenticate to AWS and create an EC2 instance under the AWS free tier. Write and validate Terraform configuration, initialize a configuration directory, and plan and apply a configuration to create infrastructure.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Change infrastructure
tutorials.description: Modify EC2-instance configuration to use a different Ubuntu version. Plan and apply the changes to re-provision a new instance that reflects the new configuration. Learn how Terraform handles infrastructure change management.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Destroy infrastructure
tutorials.description: Destroy AWS infrastructure managed by Terraform. Evaluate the plan and confirm the destruction.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Define input variables
tutorials.description: Declare your AWS EC2 instance name as a variable. Reference the variable in Terraform configuration. Define variables using command line flags and default values.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Query data with outputs
tutorials.description: Declare output values to display an EC2 instance's ID and public IP address. Display all outputs and query specific outputs. Define what data stored in Terraform state is relevant to the operator or end user.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Store remote state
tutorials.description: Configure Terraform to store state in HCP Terraform. Add a remote state block directly to configuration or set an environment variable to load remote state configuration when Terraform initializes.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

featuredCollections.name: Get Started - Azure
featuredCollections.description: Build, change, and destroy Azure infrastructure using Terraform. Step-by-step, command-line tutorials will walk you through the Terraform basics for the first time.

tutorials.name: What is Infrastructure as Code with Terraform?
tutorials.description: Learn how infrastructure as code lets you safely build, change, and manage infrastructure. Try Terraform.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Install Terraform
tutorials.description: Install Terraform on Mac, Linux, or Windows by downloading the binary or using a package manager (Homebrew or Chocolatey). Then create a Docker container locally by following a quick-start tutorial to check that Terraform installed correctly.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Build infrastructure
tutorials.description: Initialize, plan and apply configuration in a directory to create an Azure resource group. Inspect the Terraform state to discover the group ID once Terraform creates it.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Change infrastructure
tutorials.description: Add tags to an existing Azure resource group to learn how Terraform manages infrastructure changes. Edit Terraform configuration, then plan and apply the change.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Destroy infrastructure
tutorials.description: Destroy Azure infrastructure managed by Terraform. Evaluate the plan and confirm the destruction.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Define input variables
tutorials.description: Declare your Azure resource group name as a variable. Reference the variable in Terraform configuration. Define a variable using command line flags or default values.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Query data with output values
tutorials.description: Declare output values to display an Azure resource group ID. Display all outputs and query specific outputs.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Store remote state
tutorials.description: Configure Terraform to store state in HCP Terraform. Add a remote state block directly to configuration or set an environment variable to load remote state configuration when Terraform initializes.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

featuredCollections.name: Get Started - Google Cloud
featuredCollections.description: Build, change, and destroy Google Cloud Platform (GCP) infrastructure using Terraform. Step-by-step, command-line tutorials will walk you through the Terraform basics for the first time.

tutorials.name: What is Infrastructure as Code with Terraform?
tutorials.description: Learn how infrastructure as code lets you safely build, change, and manage infrastructure. Try Terraform.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Install Terraform
tutorials.description: Install Terraform on Mac, Linux, or Windows by downloading the binary or using a package manager (Homebrew or Chocolatey). Then create a Docker container locally by following a quick-start tutorial to check that Terraform installed correctly.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Build infrastructure
tutorials.description: Authenticate to Google Cloud and create a VPC network. Write and validate Terraform configuration, initialize a configuration directory, and plan and apply a configuration to create infrastructure.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Change infrastructure
tutorials.description: Add a Google Compute Engine VM instance to a VPC by referencing the VPC in its configuration using arguments. Modify the instance by adding tags, and implement a destructive change.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Destroy infrastructure
tutorials.description: Destroy Google Cloud infrastructure managed by Terraform. Evaluate the plan and confirm the destruction.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Define input variables
tutorials.description: Declare your GCP credential location, infrastructure region and zone as variables. Reference these variables in Terraform configuration. Define them using command line flags, environment variables, .tfvars files or default values.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Query data with output values
tutorials.description: Output the public IP of your Google Cloud instance using output variables. Read about using outputs to query specific data from Terraform state.

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

certification.title: Get certified: Security automation
certification.description: Validate your cloud security skills by studying for and passing the Vault Associate certification exam.

featuredCollections.name: Get started with Vault foundations
featuredCollections.description: Vault secures, stores, and tightly controls access to tokens, passwords, certificates, API keys, and other secrets in modern computing. Start your Vault user journey here.

tutorials.name: Why use Vault
tutorials.description: Begin your Vault journey by learning why you should use Vault and the challenges that it can help you solve.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.description: Understand the different editions and deployment scenarios for Vault.

tutorials.description: What is a Vault role and how are they used to configure Vault plugins.

product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Learn to use the Vault CLI
tutorials.shortName: Learn to use the Vault CLI
tutorials.description: Learn to use the Vault CLI to interact with a dev server.

product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Learn to use the Vault UI

tutorials.description: Learn to use the Vault UI to interact with a dev server.

product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Learn to use the Vault HTTP API

tutorials.description: Learn to use the Vault HTTP API to control authentication and access secrets in Vault.

product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Understand static and dynamic secrets
tutorials.description: What are static and dynamic secrets in Vault and how to use them.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Troubleshoot Vault
tutorials.description: Explore the basics of troubleshooting Vault by Learning about the observability data Vault provides and how you can use it for resolving issues.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

tutorials.name: Next steps
tutorials.description: HashiCups has successfully concluded their POC of Vault. Learn about the next steps in your Vault learning journey.

product.name: Vault
product.description: Learn about secrets management and data protection with HashiCorp Vault.

certification.title: Get certified: Network automation
certification.description: Validate your service networking skills by studying for and passing the Consul Associate certification exam.

featuredCollections.description: Install Consul on Kubernetes and quickly explore service mesh features such as service-to-service permissions with intentions, ingress with API Gateway, and enhanced observability.

featuredCollections.name: Get Started
featuredCollections.description:
Get up and running with Nomad by learning about scheduling, setting up
a cluster, and deploying an example job.

tutorials.name: Introduction to Nomad
tutorials.description: Discover what HashiCorp Nomad is, become familiar with important related terms, and understand how Nomad fits into the application development workflow.

product.name: Nomad
product.description: Learn to deploy applications at any scale with HashiCorp Nomad

tutorials.name: Install the Nomad CLI
tutorials.description: Install the Nomad CLI on Mac, Windows, or Linux.

product.name: Nomad
product.description: Learn to deploy applications at any scale with HashiCorp Nomad

tutorials.name: Create a Nomad cluster
tutorials.description: Create a local development cluster on your machine or a cloud-based one on AWS, Azure, or GCP.

product.name: Nomad
product.description: Learn to deploy applications at any scale with HashiCorp Nomad

product.name: Terraform
product.description: Learn to provision infrastructure with HashiCorp Terraform

tutorials.name: Deploy and update a Nomad job
tutorials.description: Use the Nomad CLI to deploy an example application. Then update the application's jobspec and redeploy it.

product.name: Nomad
product.description: Learn to deploy applications at any scale with HashiCorp Nomad

tutorials.name: Stop Nomad and clean up
tutorials.description: Stop and clean up the application jobs in Nomad. Destroy the cluster resources and discover additional topics to continue your Nomad learning.

product.name: Nomad
product.description: Learn to deploy applications at any scale with HashiCorp Nomad

featuredCollections.name: Cluster Setup
featuredCollections.description: Provision a Nomad cluster in the Cloud with Consul and Access Control Lists (ACLs) enabled.

tutorials.name: Nomad clusters on the cloud
tutorials.description: Discover how to create a Nomad cluster with ACLs enabled and use it as a starting point for your Nomad workloads on AWS, Azure, or GCP.

tutorials.name: Set up a Nomad cluster on AWS
tutorials.description: Create a Nomad cluster with Consul on AWS and then enable ACLs. Use this cluster as a starting point for your Nomad workloads.

product.name: Nomad
product.description: Learn to deploy applications at any scale with HashiCorp Nomad

featuredCollections.name: Deploy and Manage Nomad Jobs

Learn the fundamentals of expressing your workload as Nomad jobs. Submit,
inspect, and monitor a running Nomad job.

tutorials.name: Deploy and manage jobs
tutorials.description: Discover the job workflow, how to deploy a job, and how to update a running job.

product.description: Learn to deploy applications at any scale with HashiCorp Nomad

tutorials.name: Configure Nomad job tasks
tutorials.description: Provide values to a Nomad workload through jobspec configuration files, command line arguments, and environment variables.

tutorials.description: Create a Nomad job file and follow the job workflow to plan, submit, update, and run a job.

featuredCollections.name: Getting Started with Docker
featuredCollections.description: HashiCorp Packer automates the creation of any type of machine image, including Docker images. You'll build a  Docker image on your local machine without using any  paid cloud resources.

tutorials.name: Install Packer
tutorials.description: Packer must first be installed on the machine you want to run it on.

product.name: Packer
product.description: Learn how to build automated machine images of using Packer.

tutorials.name: Build an image
tutorials.description:
With Packer installed, let's just dive right into it and build our first
image. Packer can create images for many platforms with anything pre-installed.
In this example, you will build a Docker image with Packer.

product.name: Packer
product.description: Learn how to build automated machine images of using Packer.

tutorials.name: Provision
tutorials.description:
Packer fully supports automated provisioning in order to install software
onto machines prior to turning them into images.

product.name: Packer
product.description: Learn how to build automated machine images of using Packer.

tutorials.name: Variables
tutorials.description: Packer templates can be parameterized using variables.

product.name: Packer
product.description: Learn how to build automated machine images of using Packer.

tutorials.name: Parallel builds
tutorials.description:
Create multiple images for multiple platforms in parallel, from one Packer
template, by creating a source. Build Ubuntu and Ubuntu Focal images for Docker.

product.name: Packer
product.description: Learn how to build automated machine images of using Packer.

tutorials.name: Post-processors
tutorials.description:
Packer also has the ability to modify the artifact of a build once the
instance has been shut down

product.name: Packer
product.description: Learn how to build automated machine images of using Packer.

featuredCollections.name: Get Started with HCP Packer
featuredCollections.description: HCP Packer registry stores Packer image metadata, enabling you to track your  image lifecycle. Build an Ubuntu machine image, push its metadata to AWS, and  reference the images in Terraform or Packer configuration.

tutorials.description: Push an artifact's metadata to the Packer registry. Explore the Packer  registry dashboard and view version details.

tutorials.description: Create an HCP Packer channel and assign a version to the channel. Query the release channel and deploy the artifact with Terraform.

featuredCollections.name: HCP Waypoint
featuredCollections.description: HCP Waypoint lets platform teams build golden patterns and workflows for developers to manage applications at scale. Developers can deploy self-service application infrastructure with a reusable template and add-on that includes a pre-populated code repository and no-code Terraform modules.

crossProductSectionCollections.name: Cloud Operating Model
crossProductSectionCollections.description: The Cloud Operating Model is a new approach for IT operations that organizations need to be successful with cloud adoption and thrive in an era of multi-cloud architecture.

tutorials.name: What is the cloud operating model?
tutorials.description: The cloud operating model is a new approach for IT operations that organizations need to be successful with cloud adoption and thrive in an era of multi-cloud architecture.

tutorials.description: Implement HashiCorp Well-Architected Framework at your organization.

crossProductSectionCollections.name: Network automation
crossProductSectionCollections.description: Automate infrastructure changes based on changes to the Consul catalog using Consul-Terraform-Sync and  learn how Consul's built-in load balancing features help applications automatically adapt to changes in services.

tutorials.name: Automate reverse proxy configuration with consul-template
tutorials.description: Discover how to automate NGINX configuration as a reverse proxy using Consul service catalog and consul-template. Use Consul KV store to define extra parameters for your NGINX configuration and update configuration automatically when something changes in your service landscape.

product.description: Learn how to run service discovery and a service mesh with Consul.
